amendment.description: An amendment numbered 149 printed in House Report 115-297 to increase CDC funding by $40 million for an opioid drug overdose prevention program, increases National Cancer Institute funding by $40 million for pediatric cancer research, increases National Institute on Aging funding by $40 million for Alzheimer's research, decreases CMS Program Management by $120 million.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Flores amendment (A133) Failed by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Flores amendment (A133) Failed by voice vote.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A133) offered by Mr. Flores.
